intro: Ligustrum tenuipes, commonly known as the slender privet, is a species of flowering plant in the Oleaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, fleshy berries. Ligustrum tenuipes is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
